ygData.subject: Re: [eqenchanters] any reason to buy your illusion:your race?
ygData.msgSnippet: From my understanding, the illusions give you the base faction of the race then any faction modifiers you ve earned already are applied (e.g. if you ve killed
ygData.messageBody:
From my understanding, the illusions give you the base faction of the race
then any faction modifiers you've earned already are applied (e.g. if you've
killed a lot of DE guards, illusion:DE won't help you because you've earned
a very low faction with them already). So as an Erudite, you already have
the base faction and it wouldn't do anything other than make you look like
yourself *shrug*

Tinik
level 22 gnomish enchanter, Veeshan

p.s. no, I haven't killed any DE guards :)

----- Original Message -----
From: "Mark Rafn" <dagon@...>
To: <eqenchanters@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, April 06, 2000 8:03 PM
Subject: [eqenchanters] any reason to buy your illusion:your race?


> I'm just reaching L12 with my Erudite Enchanter. I'll probably buy it
> just for completeness, but is there any actual use for Illusion:Erudite?
>
> Does it give you the "default face" of an enchanter or use your normal
> face? Is there any effect whatever?
> --
> Mark Rafn dagon@... <http://www.dagon.net/> !G
>
